content:
Diagnosis:
Papillary renal cell carcinoma type 2, right kidney

Staging:
pT2N0M0 (AJCC 8th edition)
MET mutation positive
Diagnosis confirmed 12 March 2024

Previous medical history:
Hypertension
Type 2 diabetes

Current medications:
Amlodipine 10mg daily
Metformin 1g twice daily
Ramipril 5mg daily

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
Post right radical nephrectomy performed 12 March 2024

I reviewed [redacted name] today following his recent right radical nephrectomy. The surgery was uncomplicated and he has made an excellent recovery. His wound has healed well and he reports minimal post-operative pain. His blood pressure is well controlled on current medications.

Histopathology confirms a 9cm type 2 papillary renal cell carcinoma with negative margins. There is no lymphovascular invasion. Molecular testing has identified a MET mutation. Staging CT chest/abdomen/pelvis shows no evidence of metastatic disease.

Performance status is 0. Current blood results show stable renal function with creatinine 110, normal liver function, and hemoglobin 125.

Given the high-risk features of his tumor (type 2 histology, size >7cm) but absence of metastatic disease, I have discussed the role of adjuvant therapy. We will refer his case to next week's renal MDT for discussion of potential adjuvant targeted therapy options. I have explained that current evidence for adjuvant therapy is limited but may be considered given his tumor characteristics.

Plan:
1. MDT referral completed
2. Repeat CT chest/abdomen/pelvis in 3 months
3. Review in clinic with MDT outcome in 2 weeks
4. Continue current medications
5. Blood pressure monitoring with GP

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: 9cm type 2 papillary renal cell carcinoma, negative margins, no lymphovascular invasion

Staging CT chest/abdomen/pelvis shows no evidence of metastatic disease

status_updates.value: Recently diagnosed high-risk localized papillary renal cell carcinoma post nephrectomy. Under consideration for adjuvant targeted therapy given high-risk features.
Review in clinic with MDT outcome in 2 weeks
